articles.author: Scott Neuman
articles.title: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned - NPR
articles.description: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.
articles.content: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro is the latest chapter in a long history of U.S. intervention in the Caribbean basin, rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine bu… [+10215 chars]

articles.author: ALI SWENSON
articles.title: Health subsidies expire, launching millions of Americans into 2026 with steep insurance hikes - ABC7 New York
articles.description: Enhanced tax credits that have helped Americans offset the cost of Affordable Care Act health insurance for the last four years expired overnight.
articles.content: Enhanced tax credits that have helped reduce the cost of health insurance for the vast majority of Affordable Care Act enrollees expired overnight, cementing higher health costs for millions of Ameri… [+5144 chars]
